byline.contributor: Aaron E. Carroll is a professor of pediatrics at Indiana University School of Medicine who blogs on health research and policy at The Incidental Economist and makes videos at Healthcare Triage. Follow him on Twitter at @aaronecarroll.

abstract: The Upshot; National Bureau of Economic Research working paper, linking horrors of unethical research involved in infamousTuskegee experiment with lack of trust on part of older African-American men in health care system, may be drawing a causal link that misses complexities of reasons for racially-based mistrust in American government.
lead_paragraph: A study makes a leap to causality, but it’s not as if racism stopped: We should be careful about blaming a single incident in the past.

headline.main: Did Infamous Tuskegee Study Cause Lasting Mistrust of Doctors Among Blacks?
headline.print_headline: A Mistrust of Doctors That Runs Deeper Than One Study
